program_info.title: 15-Month Planche Mastery Program
important_notes: Always warm up for 10-15 minutes before training
If you feel pain (not fatigue), rest immediately
Sleep 7-9 hours per night for recovery
Stay hydrated and eat adequate protein

checklist: Warm-up: Wrist circles, shoulder rotations, cat-cow stretches (10 min)
Crow pose practice: 3 attempts, hold as long as possible
Warm-up: Arm circles, dead hangs, band pull-aparts (10 min)
Pull-up negatives: 5 sets of 3-5 reps (5 second descent)
Hollow body hold: 3 sets of 30-45 seconds
Leg raises (bent knee): 3 sets of 10 reps
Hollow body hold: 4 sets of 45 seconds
Arch body hold: 4 sets of 30 seconds
Compression work (seated, pulling knees to chest): 3 sets of 30 seconds
Handstand wall hold: 3 sets of 20-30 seconds
Pseudo planche push-ups (lean forward): 4 sets of 6-10 reps
Plank to downward dog: 3 sets of 10 reps
Shoulder taps in plank: 3 sets of 20 taps total
Pull-ups: 5 sets to failure (aim for 2-3 reps minimum)
Face pulls or band pull-aparts: 3 sets of 15 reps
Push-ups: 100 total (break into as many sets as needed)
Wall handstand hold: 5 sets of 30 seconds
Frog stand attempts: 5 attempts, hold as long as possible
L-sit tuck progression: 3 sets of 15-20 seconds
Wrist conditioning: Rice bucket or wrist rolls
Complete rest or very light activity (walking, yoga)
Review weekly progress and adjust if needed

milestone_check: Can you do 30+ push-ups consistently?
Can you do 3-5 pull-ups?
Can you hold crow pose for 10+ seconds?
Can you hold tuck L-sit for 10+ seconds?

checklist: Warm-up: Wrist mobility, shoulder prep (10 min)
Pseudo planche push-ups (more lean): 5 sets of 8-10 reps
Frog stand: 5 sets of max hold (goal: 20+ seconds)
Planche lean holds: 4 sets of 15-20 seconds
Archer rows: 3 sets of 8 reps each side
Front lever tuck pulls: 3 sets of 5 reps
Hollow body hold: 4 sets of 60 seconds
Hanging leg raises (bent knee): 3 sets of 10 reps
Scapular strength work: 3 sets of 12 reps
Planche lean holds: 5 sets of 20-25 seconds
Hollow body rocks: 3 sets of 20 reps
RTO support hold (on rings if available): 3 sets of 20-30 seconds
Decline pike push-ups: 4 sets of 10 reps
Pseudo planche holds: 4 sets of 20 seconds
Plank variations: 3 sets of 60 seconds each
Frog stand to headstand attempts: 5 attempts
Wide grip pull-ups: 3 sets of 5 reps
Skin the cat (if able): 3 sets of 3-5 reps
Shoulder dislocates with band: 3 sets of 15 reps
Frog stand practice: 6 sets of max hold
L-sit progression work: 5 sets of 25-30 seconds
Push-up variations circuit: 3 rounds (wide, diamond, pike)
Core finisher: 100 total hollow body rocks
Active recovery: light walk or swim

milestone_check: Can you do 8+ pull-ups?
Can you hold crow pose for 30+ seconds?
Can you hold frog stand for 20+ seconds?
Can you hold tuck L-sit for 20+ seconds?

checklist: Warm-up: Comprehensive wrist and shoulder prep (12 min)
Tuck planche attempts: 6 sets of max hold (aim 5-10 seconds)
Planche lean holds: 4 sets of 25-30 seconds
Pseudo planche push-ups (deep lean): 4 sets of 8 reps
Protraction holds elevated: 3 sets of 20 seconds
Tuck front lever holds: 4 sets of 10-15 seconds
Front lever negatives: 3 sets of 5 reps
Straight arm lat pulldowns (if gym access): 3 sets of 12
Hanging leg raises (straight leg): 3 sets of 8 reps
One-leg L-sit: 3 sets of 15 seconds each leg
Hollow body hold: 4 sets of 75 seconds
Pike push-ups (elevated feet): 4 sets of 10 reps
Tuck planche push-up negatives: 3 sets of 5 reps
Planche lean to push-up: 3 sets of 6 reps
RTO support holds: 4 sets of 30 seconds
Archer pull-ups: 4 sets of 5 reps each side
Wide grip pull-ups: 4 sets of 8 reps
Muscle-up progression (if ready): 3 sets of attempts
Skin the cat: 3 sets of 5 reps
German hang holds: 3 sets of 30 seconds
Tuck planche practice: 8 sets of max hold
Handstand practice (chest to wall): 5 sets of 60 seconds
L-sit variations: 5 sets of 30 seconds different variations

milestone_check: Can you do 10+ clean pull-ups?
Can you hold tuck planche for 10+ seconds?
Can you hold tuck L-sit for 30+ seconds?
Can you hold tuck front lever for 10+ seconds?

checklist: Tuck planche push-up negatives: 4 sets of 5 reps
Frog stand to tuck planche transitions: 4 sets of 5 transitions
Pseudo planche push-ups (maximum lean): 4 sets of 10 reps
Elevated protraction holds: 3 sets of 30 seconds
Advanced tuck front lever: 5 sets of 15 seconds
Front lever rows (tuck): 3 sets of 6 reps
One-arm hang practice: 3 sets of 15 seconds each arm
Core: Dragon flags (tuck): 3 sets of 8 reps
Full L-sit attempts: 5 sets of max hold
L-sit to V-sit transitions: 3 sets of 5 transitions
Hollow body to arch rocks: 3 sets of 20 transitions
Manna lean prep: 3 sets of 20 seconds
Handstand shoulder taps: 3 sets of 20 taps
Ring dips (if available): 4 sets of 12 reps
Pseudo planche to HSPU: 3 sets of 5 reps
Tuck planche hold into push: 4 sets (10 sec hold + 5 push-ups)
Straight bar dips: 4 sets of 15 reps
Typewriter pull-ups: 3 sets of 6 total reps
Skin the cat: 4 sets of 6 reps
Tuck planche max hold test: 3 attempts
Tuck planche push-ups: 5 sets to failure
Pull-up max set: 1 set to failure

milestone_check: Can you hold tuck planche for 20+ seconds?
Can you do 3-5 tuck planche push-ups?
Can you do 12+ pull-ups?
Can you hold L-sit for 40+ seconds?

goals: Transition to advanced tuck planche (knees extend back more)

checklist: Advanced tuck planche: 6 sets of max hold (aim 8-12 seconds)
Advanced tuck planche leans: 4 sets of 20 seconds
One-arm planche lean: 3 sets of 10 seconds each arm
Archer pull-ups: 4 sets of 6 each side
Straddle front lever: 5 sets of 10-15 seconds
Front lever pulls (advanced tuck): 4 sets of 5 reps
Hanging windshield wipers: 3 sets of 10 reps
Hollow body to tuck planche: 3 sets of 5 transitions
Handstand push-ups (free or wall): 5 sets of 10 reps
Planche push-ups (adv tuck negatives): 4 sets of 5 reps
Pseudo planche explosive push-ups: 4 sets of 8 reps
Ring push-ups (turned out): 4 sets of 12 reps
One-arm pull-up progression: 4 sets each side
German hang to inverted hang: 3 sets of 5 transitions
Advanced tuck planche practice: 8 sets of max hold
Handstand free-standing: 10 sets of attempts (aim 10+ sec)
L-sit to handstand press attempts: 5 sets

milestone_check: Can you hold advanced tuck planche for 10+ seconds?
Can you hold full L-sit for 45+ seconds?
Can you do 15+ pull-ups?
Can you hold straddle front lever for 10+ seconds?

goals: Hold advanced tuck planche for 20+ seconds

checklist: Straddle planche attempts: 6 sets of max hold (aim 3-5 seconds)
Advanced tuck planche: 4 sets of 20 seconds
Straddle planche leans: 5 sets of 20 seconds
Single-leg assisted straddle: 4 sets of 10 seconds each
Planche push-ups (advanced tuck): 5 sets of 8 reps
Explosive pull-ups to chest: 4 sets of 5 reps
Full front lever: 5 sets of 10-15 seconds
Front lever rows: 4 sets of 6 reps
One-arm pull-up progressions: 4 sets each side
Core: Ab wheel rollouts: 4 sets of 12 reps
Pike compression pulses: 5 sets of 50 reps
Handstand press negatives: 4 sets of 5 reps
Straddle planche negatives: 5 sets of 5 seconds descent
Pseudo planche to handstand: 3 sets of 5 reps
Ring turned-out support: 4 sets of 45 seconds
Ice cream makers: 3 sets of 5 reps
Full front lever: test max hold

milestone_check: Can you hold advanced tuck planche for 20+ seconds?
Can you hold straddle planche for 5+ seconds?
Can you do 10+ tuck planche push-ups?
Can you hold handstand free for 30+ seconds?

checklist: Straddle planche: 7 sets of max hold (aim 8-12 seconds)
Straddle planche leans: 5 sets of 25 seconds
Single-leg to straddle transitions: 4 sets of 5 transitions
Advanced tuck planche: 3 sets of 25 seconds (maintenance)
Straddle planche push-up negatives: 4 sets of 5 reps
Protraction strength work: 4 sets of 40 seconds
Wide grip pull-ups: 4 sets of 12 reps
Full front lever: 5 sets of 20 seconds
Front lever touch pulls: 4 sets of 5 reps
Victorian leans on rings: 3 sets of 15 seconds
Hanging leg raises (straight): 4 sets of 15 reps
Straddle planche on parallettes: 5 sets of 8-10 seconds
Pseudo planche push-ups (max lean): 4 sets of 12 reps
One-arm pull-up work: 5 sets each side
Typewriter pull-ups slow: 4 sets of 6 total
Ice cream makers: 4 sets of 6 reps
Straddle planche quality work: 8 sets of max hold
Planche to handstand transitions: 3 sets of 3 reps

milestone_check: Can you hold straddle planche for 10+ seconds?
Can you do straddle planche push-up negatives?
Can you do 18+ pull-ups?
Can you press to handstand (assisted)?

checklist: Straddle planche push-ups: 5 sets of 3-5 reps
One-leg planche attempts: 5 sets of max hold each leg
Straddle planche to tuck transitions: 4 sets of 5
Advanced straddle leans: 4 sets of 30 seconds
Archer pull-ups (slow): 4 sets of 8 each side
Front lever pull-ups: 4 sets of 5 reps
Core: Full dragon flags: 4 sets of 10 reps
Press to handstand (straddle): 5 sets of 5 attempts
Explosive handstand push-ups: 4 sets of 8 reps
Ring work: 5 sets of 45 second holds (various positions)
Planche to handstand attempts: 4 sets of 3 reps
One-arm negatives: 4 sets of 5 reps each side
Straddle planche max hold test: 2 attempts
Pull-up max test: 1 set to failure

milestone_check: Can you hold straddle planche for 15+ seconds?
Can you do 3-5 straddle planche push-ups?
Can you hold one-leg planche for 5+ seconds?
Can you do 20+ pull-ups?

checklist: Full planche attempts: 6 sets of max hold (aim 3-5 seconds)
One-leg planche: 5 sets of 10 seconds each leg
Full planche leans: 5 sets of 20 seconds
Straddle to full planche attempts: 4 sets of 5 transitions
Weighted pull-ups (max weight): 5 sets of 5 reps
One-arm pull-up attempts: 5 sets each side
Victorian on rings: 4 sets of 20 seconds
Iron Cross leans: 4 sets of 15 seconds
Straddle planche push-ups: 5 sets of 8 reps
Handstand push-ups (deficit free): 4 sets of 8 reps
Back lever to front lever: 3 sets of 5 transitions
Ice cream maker variations: 4 sets of 8 reps
Full planche attempts: 8 sets of max hold
One-leg planche max: test each leg
Handstand press to full planche attempts: 5 sets

milestone_check: Can you hold straddle planche for 20+ seconds?
Can you hold one-leg planche for 10+ seconds?
Can you hold full planche for 3-5 seconds?
Can you do one-arm pull-up (assisted or full)?

checklist: Full planche: 7 sets of max hold (aim 6-10 seconds)
Full planche leans: 5 sets of 25 seconds
One-leg to full transitions: 4 sets of 5 transitions each side
Full planche push-up negatives: 5 sets of 5 reps
One-arm pull-ups: 5 sets of 3-5 reps each side
Press to planche: 5 sets of attempts
Ring muscle-ups to support: 5 sets of 8 reps
Maltese to planche: 4 sets of 3 transitions
Pull-up max effort: various grips, 200 total reps
Back lever variations: 5 sets of 40 seconds
One-arm hang: 4 sets of 45 seconds each
All planche variations: test each for max hold

milestone_check: Can you hold full planche for 8+ seconds?
Can you do full planche negatives?
Can you hold one-leg planche for 15+ seconds?
Can you do one-arm pull-up?

checklist: Full planche push-ups: 5 sets of 3-5 reps
Planche on rings: 5 sets of max hold
Full planche to handstand: 3 sets of 3 transitions
One-arm pull-ups: 5 sets of 5+ reps each
Weighted pull-ups (very heavy): 5 sets of 5 reps
Iron Cross on rings: 5 sets of max hold
Impossible dips: 5 sets of max reps
Ring dips (full RTO): 5 sets of 15 reps
Full planche on parallettes: 5 sets of 10+ seconds
Handstand push-up variations: 5 sets of 10 reps
One-arm pull-up max: test each side
Full planche max hold: 2 attempts for record

milestone_check: Can you hold full planche for 12+ seconds?
Can you do 3+ full planche push-ups?
Can you hold planche on rings?
Is your form on all skills excellent?

goals: Hold full planche for 15+ seconds with perfect form
All bonus skills at high level

checklist: Full planche perfect form: 6 sets of 15+ seconds
Full planche push-ups: 5 sets of 5-7 reps
Planche press to handstand: 5 sets of attempts
All planche variations for quality: 20 minutes
One-arm pull-ups: 5 sets of 8+ reps each
All front lever variations: 5 sets each
Handstand push-up mastery: 5 sets of 15 reps
All muscle-up types: 5 sets of 10 reps each
Full planche max hold: ultimate test

milestone_check: Can you hold full planche for 15+ seconds with perfect form?
Can you do 5+ full planche push-ups?
Can you hold planche on rings for 8+ seconds?
Have you mastered all progressions?

checklist: Full planche push-ups: 5 sets of 8-10 reps
Total planche volume: aim for 120+ seconds cumulative
One-arm pull-ups: 5 sets of 10 reps each
Planche to handstand to press: 5 sets
One-arm work: 5 sets each side (all variations)
Full planche max hold: push for 20+ seconds
Document all progress: photos and videos

milestone_check: Can you hold full planche for 20+ seconds?
Can you do 8+ full planche push-ups?
Have you mastered all variations?
Is your form absolutely perfect?

checklist: Full planche quality: 5 sets of 25+ seconds
Full planche push-ups: 5 sets of 10+ reps
Ring planche excellence: 6 sets of 15+ seconds
One-arm pull-ups: 5 sets of 12+ reps each
All push variations: perfect form focus
Handstand push-up excellence: 5 sets of 20 reps
Full planche max: aim for 25+ seconds

milestone_check: Can you hold full planche for 25+ seconds?
Can you do 10+ full planche push-ups?
Have you mastered all skills?
Are you ready for month 15 finale?

checklist: Full planche push-ups: 5 sets of 12+ reps
Ring planche mastery: 5 sets of 20+ seconds
One-arm pull-ups: 5 sets of 15 reps each
Full planche FINAL TEST: aim for 30+ seconds
Full planche push-ups FINAL TEST: maximum reps
Document ALL achievements: photos, videos, measurements
Rest and reflect on entire journey
Celebrate your achievement - YOU DID IT!
Consider what advanced skills to pursue next
Thank yourself for 15 months of dedication
Share your journey to inspire others

milestone_check: Can you hold full planche for 30+ seconds?
Can you do 12+ full planche push-ups?
Have you mastered ALL skills?
Are you ready to teach others?
CONGRATULATIONS - YOU ACHIEVED THE FULL PLANCHE!

nutrition_guidelines.calories: Slight surplus if building, maintenance for skill work
nutrition_guidelines.supplements: Optional: Creatine, Omega-3, Vitamin D, Magnesium

recovery_protocols.injury_prevention: Never train through pain, only through fatigue
recovery_protocols.active_recovery: Walking, swimming, yoga on rest days

progress_tracking.weekly: Take notes on hold times and reps achieved
progress_tracking.monthly: Take photos and videos from same angles
progress_tracking.measurements: Track bodyweight, max holds, max reps

mental_preparation.visualization: Practice mental imagery of perfect planche daily
mental_preparation.patience: Trust the process, progress is not linear
mental_preparation.consistency: Missing one day is OK, missing three is not
mental_preparation.form_over_ego: Perfect form is more important than hold time

warning_signs: Persistent wrist pain (reduce volume, add rehab)
safety_notes.injury_protocol: If injured, rest 1-2 weeks minimum and see a physiotherapist
form_priorities: Hands under shoulders or slightly forward

final_message: This 15-month journey will transform you into an elite calisthenics athlete. The full planche is not just about strengthit's about dedication, patience, and trusting the process. There will be hard days, plateaus, and moments of doubt. Push through them. Your 27-year-old body is MORE than capable. Stay consistent, listen to your body, and celebrate every milestone. In 15 months, you'll look back at this moment and be amazed at what you've achieved. Now go get that planche!
